column4: /pub is either unnecessary or wrong, apart from that it's fine
chelz still getting a failure to fetch files
us.archive.ubuntu.com is likely under heavy load right now. try replacing "us.archive.ubuntu.com" with "ubuntu.osuosl.org", see if that works.
ok
Failed to fetch http://ubuntu.osuosl.org/ubuntu/dists/lucid/Release  Unable to find expected entry  main/binary-lpia/Packages in Meta-index file (malformed Release file?)
I joined the channel in the middle of your problem. Are you attempting to upgrade to Lucid, or do you already have Lucid installed and are having problems getting updates?
attempting to upgrade
use the official instructions instead of editing sources.list
you missed that part of troubleshooting, i've update manager, and the upgrade button is greyed out
i've used *
What version of Ubuntu are you using right now?
Ubuntu 8.04.2
i was trying to add another mirror at the suggestion of another helper in here.. becuase this is a dell mini 10 and we thought i didn't have the correct mirrors

Have you tried the command-line instructions at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LucidUpgrades#Network%20Upgrade%20for%20Ubuntu%20Servers%20%28Recommended%29 ? It says they're for Ubuntu Server, but will work with Desktop too.
not yet, i'll give a try
yea, i have, i get this message: "No new release found"
oh, I think I see what's going on. What's the output of the "uname -a" Terminal command?
Linux scollier 2.6.24-24-lpia #1 SMP Sat Sep 12 02:59:41 UTC 2009 i686 GNU/Linux
http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/releasenotes/1004#LPIA%20architecture%20discontinued
that'll do it.
thanks
